titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that the deduction for certain attorney fees shall be fully allowable in computing both taxable income and alternative minimum taxable income.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that the deduction for certain attorney fees shall be fully allowable in computing both taxable income and alternative minimum taxable income.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exempt from the limitation on miscellaneous itemized tax deductions (i.e., only expenses in excess of two percent of adjusted gross income are deductible) any deduction for attorney fees paid by or on behalf of a taxpayer in connection with damages from a lawsuit or settlement agreement received by such taxpayer.
